article.headline: Here's what's coming to Hulu in August 2020, and what's leaving
article.body: Hulu may not have many originals debuting in August 2020, but it's adding enough action movies to make up for it. Next month's slim slate of originals including the Vince Vaughn comedy "The Binge" (Aug. 28), a "Purge" parody where fun is banned, except for one day a year where everyone lets loose; "Slay the Dragon" (Aug. 6), a political documentary about gerrymandering; Season 3 of the teen dramedy "Find Me in Paris" (Aug. 21); and "This Is Dominic Fike: The Next Big Thing?" (Aug. 7), a documentary produced in conjunction with FX and the New York Times about an obscure young musician who's given a $4 million record deal, and detailing the making of his first album and international tour. There's also a smattering of bingeable favorites, like fresh seasons of "Chopped," "House Hunters International" and "Naked and Afraid" (all Aug. 15). Also: What's coming in August to Netflix | Amazon Prime Video | HBO Max And more:Here's what's worth streaming in August 2020: 'Lovecraft Country,' 'Immigration Nation' and more And in this summer without movie blockbusters, the Walt Disney Co. DIS, +1.53%  -controlled streaming service is also adding a bunch of older movies, including action-packed favorites such as "3:10 to Yuma,""Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World," "Top Gun," six "Star Trek" films (all Aug. 1) and a pair of James Bond movies, "Casino Royale" and "Quantum of Solace" (both Aug. 31) Watch 'em while you can, some of the new movie additions are also leaving at the end of the month. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Here's a
